meanings.definition: A person who makes improvements or corrections to something.
meanings.sent1: The diligent emenders worked together to fix the broken fence.
meanings.sent2: The team of emenders enhanced the website's functionality.
meanings.sent3: The group of emenders decided to throw a party after successfully repairing the old clock.
meanings.sent4: She was like an emender of broken hearts, always there to mend the hurt.
meanings.sent5: The skilled emenders transformed the dull painting into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of making improvements or corrections to something.
meanings.sent1: The emenders' dedication led to the successful renovation of the historic building.
meanings.sent2: The emenders' efforts resulted in a more efficient workflow.
meanings.sent3: The emenders' dance moves were so smooth, they could fix any mistake on the spot.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like emenders, smoothing out the rough edges of the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The emenders' impact was evident in the flawless final product.
